job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: You get experience if you haven't had a job before or if you have been out of the workforce for a while. You can work from home.
cons: No pay raises and no upward movement readily available.

job_title: Licensed Health Agent in Tampa, FL
pros: Very communicative on the processing of employment and obtaining equipment.
cons: I just don't like obtaining positions through 3rd parties, always feel like I'm being short-changed.

review_title: Would not recommend it was good at first then went down
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Burlington, NC
pros: They will hire you i give them that
cons: $charged you for headsets twice still haven't received $ back

pros: Some good experience as far as exposure to working with a multidisciplinary team, can sometimes be flexible with hours depending on your schedule and census, and a good introductory position for behavioral health.
cons: Constant changing policies/procedures, pi*s poor communication between "leadership" and rest of treatment team, no idea of job security, poor communication/continuum of care amongst all the departments, terrible training or complete lack thereof,  high turnover rate, little opportunities for advancement unless you are "in" with the higher ups, EXTREME lack of leadership. I understand this is a startup but this is really ridiculous.

review_title: Very demanding job with little room for growth
pros: Great learning opportunity for new graduates as I was, but the organization is a startup. This means there are significant changes, reorganization of leadership, etc. very frequently and without warning.  Work is interesting and challenging (in a good way, usually).
cons: The list of responsibilities for this role is seemingly endless. I get home and feel like I did the work of 3 people. Expect to work in an inpatient-type setting, although Aloria is classified as "residential".  A good amount of the clients are not res-appropriate, and I feel many staff members did not receive adequate training to work with this acute of a population.

pros: Creative atmosphere, a number of great coworkers who functioned as a team and helped each other as needed to be successful and create a positive experience for clients.
cons: Scheduling - mandatory evenings and weekends in some departments, excessively large workload for employees, constantly changing policies & procedures, inconsistent employee treatment by management, low employee morale

review_title: Okay for consistent income if nothing goes wrong on your paycheck
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Paid training, a check every week
cons: Low pay, very long training with high expectations, expected to learn too many things within a little amount of time.
